if she waits until you
break up with her to tell
you that she’s pregnant,
she probably isn’t.

“chillax” will never
sound cool.

everyone has regrets.
make sure yours
are more fun
than others’.

how much you put
in is how much
you get out.

there are times to
finish first, and times
to just finish.

your sleeping
roommate does
not care how sick
the drop is.

not doing something
“the right way”
doesn’t mean that
it’s not going to work.

when borrowing
someone’s car, the
“i’ll replace the gas
i use,” part is implied.

“i’ll do it if you do,”
is a sentence that
usually ends in a
classic or tragic night--
rarely in-between.

don’t use something
temporary to win
people over, unless
you’re ready to lose
them when it goes away.

if you want to get
a song out of your
head, listen to a different
song. the same method
works for people, too.

stories are always
better when you
imitate the voices of
the people in it.

when going out as a 
small army, split up.
you cover more ground
without turning one bar
into a sausage party.

buying something
cheap that you have to
replace five times costs
more than buying a
quality one once.

living your life like it’s
a movie is legit,
but it all depends on
what movie you’re
thinking of.

being better at
arguing doesn’t make
your point more true
than the other person’s.

“okay, thanks,” and
“k thnx,” don’t always
mean the same thing.

life won’t always
reward you for being
good, but you shouldn’t
be good just to be
rewarded anyway.

when your teacher
tells you not to write
something down, do
it anyway. it’ll be on
the final.

if you follow someone
just so that they follow
you, you really don’t
understand the point
of that website.

it’s up to you
whether you want
life to be a sprint or
a marathon.

don’t be a dick about
the things you care
about. people will start
to hate the things just
because they hate you.

refreshing a website
that’s down is like
punching your blacked
out roommate. it’s not
exactly helping.

being entitled to your
opinion doesn’t mean
that you won’t ever
have to defend it.

if you don’t know how
to deal with drunk people,
but know how to deal
with kids (or vice versa),
it’s pretty much the same.

even the shittiest
songs are catchy if
you listen to them for
long enough.

if you get a cool
nickname, live up to
it. don’t waste it on
a boring life.

to avoid many weird
situations, don’t name
your pet after anyone
that you know.

if you’re not looking
forward to the
conversation, you
should probably
have it in person.

thinking you’re better
than someone else
isn’t cool. thinking
someone else is better
than you is less cool.

there’s a difference
between giving harsh
truth and intentionally
pissing people off.

anything that
doesn’t challenge you,
doesn’t change you.

to people that don’t
respect you, you can
never give advice;
you can only give
your opinion.

life’s too short
to be a dickhead.

you and your girl don't
have to follow each
other on every website.
actually, it'd probably
be better if you didn't.

unless it's your party
or you're the dj, don't
turn off the music to
play your own shit.

talk to the person
you’re mad at before
you talk about the
person you’re mad at.

your problems are
faster than you are.
don’t try to run
away from them.

unless you and your
roommate are tight like
that, at no point while
changing should you
be completely naked.

sometimes you have
to pass up the good
to get the great.

if you don’t correct
someone the first time
they say your name
wrong, good luck
doing it later.

don’t ask for advice
that you aren’t
going to take.

if she hits you with the,
“i don’t date during
summer,” you’re
seriously just
wasting your time.
